title: Need help restoring messages missing after profile creation/deletion
content:
Last night I created a new profile in an attempt to fix a problem with downloading mail. (It turned out to be on the ISP's end.) Tonight I briefly opened two copies of Thunderbird, one with the old/original profile and one with the new profile, to make sure the download would work. I was able to download my new mail to the original profile, so I moved last night's mail from the new inbox to my original inbox in the new profile, and then deleted the new profile since I don't need it. But now the past six months' worth of mail is missing from both my inbox and my sent folder! They both jump from June 13 to yesterday. I noticed it when I had the two copies open next to each other (those messages were missing in both copies), but thought maybe it was a merge problem and hoped they would be restored when I deleted the second profile. But they weren't. I absolutely did not delete all those messages and many of them are really important. Where did they go and how can I get them back? Help!!!

p.s. Sadly I haven't backed up in a while... :-(
creator: elkatd

title: mails are not downloading

title: Thunderbird gets stuck and I need to reboot my computer SOLVED caused by McAfee
content: If I shut down thunderbird by mistake and restart it, my Gmail can't be read. There is a blue line at the bottom showing it is trying to do something, but it never finishes. I close every running program, reboot, and it works fine until I mistakingly shut it down again. I have several accounts and get hundreds of emails every day. I try to keep deleting them, empty trash, and compact folders. My Imap folders in my profile are huge. Many gigabytes. I plan to migrate to a new computer and don't want to move whatever is wrong to the new computer. This means I will have to start fresh, set up the accounts, fix the signature files, etc. Then I can export the address book and import them to the new computer. This will be very time consuming. Is there some way I can delete the saved emails from the profile file and copy the rest of the profile over?
creator: patnsandy

title: PDF tab won't properly open on restart
content:
When I open a PDF inside Thunderbird it opens in a new tab. After closing and restarting Thunderbird, it will still have the open tab but doesn't display the PDF. Instead, the following error message appears: "Adresse nicht erkannt" "Eines der folgenden (imap) ist kein registriertes Protokoll oder ist in diesem Kontext nicht erlaubt." ("The address wasn't understood" "One of the following (imap) is not a registered protocol or is not allowed in this context.") When I hit the refresh button, the tab turns completely blank.

It used to be possible to leave attachment tabs open and have them properly reload after a Thunderbird restart, so I'm assuming this is a bug introduced a few versions ago?

(using 115.6.0 32-Bit with Adobe Acrobat as PDF reader, set to Preview in Thunderbird)
creator: marioiram

title: disappearing email from IMAP inbox

title: Can't send e-mail through Thunderbird
content:
When I try to send messages through Thunderbird for my comcast e-mail accounts I get the following message:

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: resomta-h1p-027912.sys.comcast.net resomta-h1p-027912.sys.comcast.net Excessive failed authentication, ESMTP server temporarily not available, please contact support.

I've checked with XFinity (Comcast) and things are working normally on their end. In fact I can send messages using the web access just fine. It's only using Thunderbird that I get this message.

title: Thunderbird New Email Visual Notification Stopped Working
content:
I've used Thunderbird for decades. I have about a dozen email accounts I monitor. I leave my emails on the server until I click on "Get Message" and I download my emails to my PC.

I'm not sure if I accidentally changed a setting, but when an account detected a new email, I'm pretty sure it used to change the account name font color to blue so I knew that there was a message to retrieve. Now it doesn't do that anymore. I still get aural notifications, but I don't know which account they are associated with.

So the problem is, I'm getting emails and I don't know it because some of the accounts are used sparsely. I have to manually check all of my accounts all day long now.

Does anyone know if this is something Tbird changed or is there a setting I accidentally changed (and can change back)?
creator: ryan.denke

title: changing font in thunderbird messages
content:
I have set a preferred font for email messages in Thunderbird (Times, Medium), and it works fine - mostly. If I move the cursor to the bottom of the message (intentionally or by mistake), the font switches.

In the upper part of the message the format/font is listed as "Body Text" and "Times", but if I end up at the bottom of the message it switches over to "Preformat" and "Fixed Width". When this happens, the message ends up with two formats/fonts -- or I have to select all the text and reset the font for the entire message....

I included a screen shot of the sample text when I enter it at the top and bottom of the message.

Any suggestions on how to avoid this and just have a single font/format as the default for the entire message? Thanks!

title: Thunderbird gets hung and I need to reboot SOLVED caused by McAfee
content:
I have submitted 2 questions on having to reboot the computer because thunderbird hung. This usually affects my main gmail account. I just discovered a way to get out without rebooting. I went to task manager and found there were 3 thunderbird processes running. (Is that normal?) I ended the third process and thunderbird quit. I restarted it and it was no longer hung.

When it is hung, there is a blue line at the right hand bottom of the page showing it is trying to do something. It hangs if I end Thunderbird and restart it. I am running Windows 11 that was upgraded from my preinstalled windows 10 computer. I keep the OS up to date.
creator: patnsandy

title: When editing events in calendar, the window does'n't expand far enough to click the "edit" button, by default.
content:
I installed the beta version of Thunderbird without realizing it's incredibly difficult to switch back to stable, so I'm stuck with beta. In beta, can someone explain the reasoning to me behind why calendar shows a view-only window when double clicking an event title instead of going directly to the editing window? It was so much easier to edit events before:

double click the title > start editing

Now, in beta, both ways to edit an event require extra steps:

right click title > click edit > scale the window larger > start editing or

double click title > scale the window larger > click edit > scale the window larger again > start editing.

It doesn't make any sense. I can't think of any reason for having two separate window states for an event - you don't need a display view and an edit view, because they both display the same information. Just have it open directly into the edit view like it used to.

I made a video to attach but it doesn't allow videos. Let me know if I can provide something else instead.

Windows 10 64bit Pro Thunderbird SUPERNOVA 122.0b1 (64-bit)
creator: namuwilliams

title: Every time you update Thunderbird, a shortcut icon is created on your desktop.
content: A similar question was asked in a previous topic on the support forum. The answer is to download the latest version and install it by overwriting it. You can then select the option not to create a shortcut icon in the installer's advanced installation. Now that's resolved, what's the problem? I was very surprised by their responses on the support forum. I have a hard time understanding why they don't add an option to Thunderbird's settings to prevent automatic updates from creating shortcut icons on the desktop. You don't understand that Mozilla's Firefox and Thunderbird are no longer popular because it is still common knowledge that they are not user friendly. Thunderbird has issued a statement saying that the project has taken off due to large donations. If so, you should provide an option to not create a shortcut icon on the desktop during this automatic update as soon as possible.
creator: Doggo

title: Thunderbird Encryption Feature (version 115)
content:
I have 3 questions I didn't see answers to in the various nicely written documents describing the end-to-end encryption feature of Thunderbird (version 115): 1) Does this encryption function also always include any attachments when encrypting an e-mail? 2) In cases where the intended recipient of a Thunderbird e-mail is known to not have decryption capability, is it possible for Thunderbird to send an encrypted e-mail with a self-opening capability after the recipient enters a key or password provided by other means? 3) Does standard Outlook have e-mail encryption compatible with Thunderbird encryption, such that I can send encrypted messages to an Outlook recipient that they can decrypt (assuming the recipient's Outlook account has its encryption feature activated, setup etc?

Thanks for your help in advancing my understanding of this feature. Regards, JS
creator: James-A
